intro: Elsiea, commonly known as the rock fern, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Elsieaceae. It is characterized by its small, delicate flowers and is often found in rocky or arid environments. The plants typically have a compact growth habit and are well adapted to withstand harsh conditions. Elsiea species are native to parts of Africa and are often grown as ornamental plants due to their unique appearance. Their botanical significance lies in their role in ecological systems and their value in horticulture.
